commitResults.messageBody:
There is currently no way to unlink a student or tutor from a class in
the app.

Being able to unlink (i.e. delete the link) is essential for the app to
be fully functional.

Create an 'unlinkClass' command that functions similarly to 'linkClass',
except it removes the link instead of creating it, between a specified
class and a student/tutor.

There is currently no way to view which tutors and students are part of
a class.

Being able to display this info is essential for the app to be fully
functional.

Create a 'getClassDetails' command that displays the relevant day, time,
tutor and students for that class.

commitResults.messageTitle: bug fix: remove unnecessary input parameter
commitResults.messageBody: Edited two methods that had unused input variables.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add test cases for unlinkClass command
Merge branch 'feature/unlink-class-command' of https://github.com/oysterboi/tp into feature/unlink-class-command
Bug fix: non-alphanumeric inputs for commands
commitResults.messageBody:
When getClasses/getParent/getStudents is run with non-alphanumeric
characters in the n/NAME parameter, the app will not respond and the
command box does not update (when it usually displays an error message
of some kind to let the user know why the command didn't run).

With no feedback to the user on why the command fails to run, it makes
it hard for users to fix the issue and continue to use the app smoothly.

Let's update the relevant parser classes to properly catch the
IllegalArgumentException and convert it to a ParseException, so that the
error logic of our code can handle it as expected.

Throughout our code, the ParseException is used to contain any errors
with parsing, attaching the relevant error message to it, for it to be
caught by the main logic and processed to be displayed in the GUI. The
main logic, however, is not designed to catch IllegalArgumentExceptions,
so it gets caught by the backend instead and does not update the GUI in
any way.

The IllegalArgumentException is thrown by the attempt to create a new
Name object in the parser classes. More specifically, the constructor
method for Name calls AppUtils::checkArgument, which takes in a boolean
(where the coder can input any conditional that evaluates to a boolean)
and throws the IllegalArgumentException if false.

commitResults.messageTitle: Bug fix: incomplete linkage updates with edit
commitResults.messageBody:
There are a bunch of issues that stem from the fact that the edit
command does not properly update all linkages when the category of a
Person is changed. For example, when a tutor is changed to a student,
the classes that the tutor is assigned to should have the tutor's ID
removed from the class, but it does not happen in the current codebase.

This bug can cause severe issues with data correctness and consistency
throughout the app. The known bugs that stem from this issue include:
- not being able to assign a new tutor to a class after changing the
category of the old tutor.
- a student remaining in the class list of a class after having its
category changed, which if they are changed back to a student in the
future, will show up in the class as a student again, even though that
link should have been removed when the student's category is changed.
- a student remaining in the class list of a class after having its
category changed, which if they are changed back to a student in the
future and assigned to a different class, allows them to be assigned to
more than one class.

Let's update EditCommand so that when the category of a person is
changed, all linkages are updated accordingly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix: minor issue with missing null check
Bug fix: linking issue with same name persons
commitResults.messageBody:
If there is a student and a tutor of the exact same name, any attempts
to link/unlink them to/from a class by name will only ever be able to
link/unlink the person who is higher up on the list.

This makes the second person fully inaccessible when it comes to linking
and unlinking classes, which is a functional issue.

Let's add an optional parameter to specify the category of the person
we want to link/unlink.

This is sufficient as the constraints of TutorFlow assert that there can
be at most three Persons of the same name, where all three are of
different categories (i.e. student, parent, tutor). Specifying the
category on top of the name will ensure the command can find a unique
person (if there is any).
